p: Linear discriminant analysis Effect Size (LEfSe) analysis allowed us to determine which fungal taxa contributed most to observed differences between S. gigantea invaded and uninvaded plots. With an LDA threshold of >2, the families Cladosporiaceae, Teratosphaeriaceae (both Ascomycota), Glomeraceae (Glomeromycota), and Kondoaceae (Basidiomycota) were shown to be more abundant in plots invaded with S. gigantea ( Figure 2A). Analysis per habitat type revealed that only the Cladosporaceae were present in higher densities in both habitat types in invaded plots ( Figure 2B,C). A higher abundance of members of the family Cucurbitariaceae (Ascomycota) was shown to be characteristic for the uninvaded plots.
